title: Wye Valley Family Adventure
tagline: Gentle river days and forest trails
suitableFor: Families with children aged 6 and up who enjoy gentle outdoor activities.  Suitable for those with limited hiking experience.
notSuitableFor: Families seeking extreme sports or challenging hikes. Those with very young children (under 6) might find some activities difficult.

stops.title: Family Canoeing on the River Wye
stops.description: Enjoy a gentle paddle down the River Wye, taking in the beautiful scenery and spotting local wildlife.

wetAlt.title: Clearwell Caves
wetAlt.description: Explore the ancient iron mines, a fascinating underground world.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by the River Wye
budgetAlt.description: Find a scenic spot along the riverbank and enjoy a packed lunch.

stops.title: The Saracens Head Inn
stops.description: Traditional pub fare with stunning views of the River Wye.

stops.title: Symonds Yat Rock Viewpoint & Short Hike
stops.description: Enjoy panoramic views of the Wye Valley from Symonds Yat Rock, followed by a short, easy hike in the surrounding forest.

wetAlt.title: Goodrich Castle
wetAlt.description: Explore the ruins of this magnificent medieval castle.

budgetAlt.title: Short walk around Symonds Yat village
budgetAlt.description: Explore the village and grab an ice cream

stops.title: The Wyndham Arms
stops.description: A family-friendly inn with comfortable rooms and a welcoming atmosphere.

budgetAlt.title: Forest of Dean Camping
budgetAlt.description: Camping at a designated campsite in the Forest of Dean.

stops.title: Puzzlewood
stops.description: Explore the magical ancient woodland with its unique rock formations, caves, and winding paths. Great for kids to explore!

wetAlt.title: Dean Heritage Centre
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history and heritage of the Forest of Dean.

budgetAlt.title: Free Forest Walk near Puzzlewood
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free walk in the surrounding forest instead of visiting Puzzlewood.

stops.title: The Butchers Arms
stops.description: A traditional pub serving locally sourced food.
stops.travelToNext: 30 min drive to Go Ape Forest of Dean

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch
budgetAlt.description: Eat a packed lunch at a picnic spot in the Forest of Dean

stops.title: Go Ape Forest of Dean
stops.description: A treetop adventure course with zip lines, rope bridges, and Tarzan swings (suitable for children over 1m tall).

wetAlt.title: Cinema in Gloucester
wetAlt.description: Go to the cinema in Gloucester if the weather doesn't allow for outdoor activities.

budgetAlt.title: Cycling on Forest Trails
budgetAlt.description: Rent bikes and explore the many forest trails (cheaper than Go Ape).

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: The Wye Valley can be unpredictable. Pack for all types of weather, even in summer. Rain is always a possibility.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on weekends and during school holidays, especially around popular attractions like Symonds Yat. Parking at Symonds Yat Rock can be limited.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Canoeing trips, Go Ape, and accommodation should be booked in advance, especially during peak season.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This trip involves some walking and gentle activity. A reasonable level of fitness is required, but it is suitable for most families.
